p.span: Marksmen Families,

This is a very fluid time for the schools as we are receiving updates and new information almost daily. I think the most efficient way to disseminate that information is to itemize a FAQ, and we will add to that list as guidance is received. I apologize in advance that we will not immediately have all of the answers to your questions, but we will work to resolve all questions as soon as possible.

span.style: overflow: hidden; display: inline-block; margin: 0.00px 0.00px; border: 0.00px solid #000000; transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); -webkit-transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); width: 188.76px; height: 53.50px;

img.style: width: 188.76px; height: 53.50px; margin-left: 0.00px; margin-top: 0.00px; transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px); -webkit-transform: rotate(0.00rad) translateZ(0px);

p.span: John Anthony Scioldo II
Superintendent, Tell City-Troy Township Schools
Question
Answer
My student still has personal belongings in the school. How can I get them?

We understand that most of our students have personal items still in the schools. We are discussing options for the pick up of personal effects at this time, probably to be done in conjunction with the drop off of school owned chromebooks and textbooks.
This will not occur until the stay-at-home order is lifted.
What about prom?
Prom has been cancelled. There is no reschedule information as we do not know when social distancing will end.
What about Graduation?

Our traditional graduation has been cancelled at this time. There is no reschedule information as we do not know when social distancing will end. We are exploring options for non-traditional recognition of our senior class.
Can I get into the buildings?
At this time, we are maintaining that only essential staff will be in the school buildings. Admission to the buildings will be by appointment only, and should only be in the case of emergencies.
This may change when the stay-at-home order is lifted, and applies to all non-essential staff.
Can I use corporation athletic facilities and playgrounds?
At this time, all athletic facilities are closed. There are no practices, scheduled or unscheduled. School athletic fields and playgrounds should not be used until further notice.
I need a work permit. How do I get one?

The Department of Labor has suspended the requirement for employers to have a work permit for minors they employ on file. The Department of Labor will not hold employers responsible to have a work permit on file for minors employed between now and May 1. More guidance on this will be provided as soon as it is available.
Will the Free Lunch Program Continue?

The corporation will continue providing free meals for children age 18 and younger on Mondays and Thursdays in the student parking lot of the Jr.Sr. High School. We will provide these meals from 11:00 AM until 1:00 PM or until we are out. We will provide three meals on Monday (including breakfasts) and will provide two meals (including next day breakfast) on Thursdays. Please respect social distancing guidelines.
How do I participate in the backpack program?
The backpack program required sign-up at the beginning of the school year. If you need assistance or would like to sign-up for the program, please contact
for elementary students and
for JSHS students.
Will there be summer school?

We don’t know. That depends primarily on the state and the virus. At this time, if we do have summer school I assume it will be in a similar format as our current instruction- eLearning from home. That will limit the optional classes we offer at the JSHS. We will update this as we receive guidance.
Will the YMCA summer program be offered?
We don’t know. That depends primarily on the state and the virus. All summer events are on hold at this time.
What will seniors have to do to graduate?
The
Principals

and guidance counselors will be reaching out to you and your parents individually regarding Graduation requirements. The state has indicated that students enrolled and in good standing are eligible to graduate with the diploma that they were on track to receive. Seniors will still have to complete all assigned work and receive passing grades to receive credits for classes. This also applies to Dual Credit and AP. Seniors are also not exempt for “attendance” if they wish to graduate with credits.
My student is taking an AP Class. What do I do?
AP students must take the AP tests to receive college credit for the classes, and should review the AP guidance
and review the AP test schedule
. You should also contact your AP teacher for assistance.
